pmhalVmVoltageDomain Struct Reference

Voltage Domain descriptor. More...

#include <hw_pmhal_common_vmdata.h>

Detailed Description

Voltage Domain descriptor.

Field Documentation

pmhalPrcmCpuId_t* pmhalVmVoltageDomain::cpuIdArr

Array which lists the CPUs in the given voltage domain

uint16_t pmhalVmVoltageDomain::maxOppNommV

Maximum OPP_NOM voltage in mV.

uint16_t pmhalVmVoltageDomain::maxSafemV

Maximum safe voltage in mV. The SoC doesn't support voltage greater than this.

uint16_t pmhalVmVoltageDomain::minOppNommV

Minimum OPP_NOM voltage in mV.

uint16_t pmhalVmVoltageDomain::minSafemV

Minimum safe voltage in mV. The SoC doesn't support voltage less than this.

uint32_t pmhalVmVoltageDomain::numCpus

Number of CPUs in the given voltage domain

uint32_t pmhalVmVoltageDomain::oppIdArr[PMHAL_VM_OPP_MAX]

Not all voltage domains have all OPPs supported. The elements of this array ensure the getOPP function returns the right value of the opp while searching through the array

const pmhalVmOppVoltage_t* pmhalVmVoltageDomain::oppVoltages[PMHAL_VM_OPP_MAX]

The nominal voltage of each OPP supported in this VD. Some OPPs are only supported in AVS. A value of zero means that the OPP is not supported.

uint32_t pmhalVmVoltageDomain::sldoCtrlAddr

Address of the register to set the corresponding voltage domain's SRAM LDO Control

uint32_t pmhalVmVoltageDomain::sldoSetupAddr

Address of the register to set the corresponding voltage domain's SRAM LDO Setup

uint32_t pmhalVmVoltageDomain::sLdoValidRetMode

One Hot encoding of the valid SRAM LDO Retention states supported Refer pmhalPrcmSramLdoRetState_t for more details
